The internet layer is the layer above the link layer. It is responsible for routing data between different networks. The internet layer protocol that is most commonly used is IP (Internet Protocol).

The transport layer is the layer above the internet layer. It is responsible for ensuring that data is delivered reliably and in the correct order. The transport layer protocol that is most commonly used is TCP (Transmission Control Protocol).

The application layer is the top-most layer of the TCP/IP model. It is responsible for providing services to applications. The application layer protocol that is most commonly used is HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol).

The STFT is a way of breaking down the audio signal into its component frequencies over time. The MFCC is then derived from the STFT by taking the logarithm of the power spectrum, multiplying it by a set of Mel filters, and then taking the discrete cosine transform (DCT) of the resulting vector. The Mel-spectrogram, on the other hand, is a representation of an audio signal that is derived from the short-time Fourier transform (STFT) of the signal, but it does not take the logarithm of the power spectrum. The Mel-spectrogram is a way of representing the audio signal in a way that is more similar to the way the human ear hears it, but it is not as detailed as the MFCC.
